item.title: AAPT Winter meeting
item.dc:creator: Freek Pols
item.description: During the AAPT Winter Meeting in St. Louis, Missouri, the open-access book Show the Physics has been presented. This book […]
item.content:encoded: During the AAPT Winter Meeting in St. Louis, Missouri, the open-access book Show the Physics has been presented. This book has been made using the Teachbook tool. Attendees were pointed to Teachbooks as a tool to (re)create and (re)use educational content.

item.title: WND-conference
item.dc:creator: Tom van Woudenberg
item.description: We joined a national Dutch conference for high school physics teachers (Werkgroep Natuurkunde Didaktiek (WND) conferentie) to host a workshop […]
item.content:encoded:
We joined a national Dutch conference for high school physics teachers (Werkgroep Natuurkunde Didaktiek (WND) conferentie) to host a workshop on how to create a TeachBook! Robert Lanzafame, Julie Kirsch and Tom van Woudenberg led this interactive session!

The room was filled with around 30 enthusiastic teachers who all started their first book! The workshop started with a presentation how TeachBooks are used in various courses at Delft univeristy of Technology. Afterwards, the attendees made their own book using our template and the included exercises. The main focus was how git can be used to effectively share and reuse open educational material and how to contribute to material from others!

The presentation is available here (in Dutch): https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.14454542

item.title: Betasteunpunt training
item.dc:creator: Freek Pols
item.description: We provided an in-house training with Betasteunpunt Zuid Holland. In this four hour training session, we introduced 29 participants – […]
item.content:encoded: We provided an in-house training with Betasteunpunt Zuid Holland. In this four hour training session, we introduced 29 participants – ranging from secondary school teachers to associate professors, and from teacher educators to retired medical doctors – to the basics of Jupyter Books.

item.title: Workshop at IIT Madras
item.dc:creator: Robert Lanzafame
item.description: Robert Lanzafame, together with Sandra Verhagen and Alexander Garzón Díaz gave multiple workshops at Indian Institute of Technology Madras on […]
item.content:encoded:
Robert Lanzafame, together with Sandra Verhagen and Alexander Garzón Díaz gave multiple workshops at Indian Institute of Technology Madras on how we use TeachBooks in our teaching, along with other related educational topics related to our MSc module MUDE (Modelling, Uncertainty and Data for Engineers).

More information will follow soon!

item.title: SURF Onderwijsdagen
item.dc:creator: Tom van Woudenberg
item.description: We hosted a presentation at a national Dutch conference on education (SURF Onderwijsdagen) with the title: Online interactive textbooks: creating […]
item.content:encoded:
We hosted a presentation at a national Dutch conference on education (SURF Onderwijsdagen) with the title: Online interactive textbooks: creating a book and using it with your students is easier than you think – we’ll prove it!

Our presentation demonstrated how we have used the books effectively in our courses at TU Delft, with students and fellow teachers, as well as how we’ve incorporated and developed innovative features. For example, Python computation in your TeachBook (100% client-side; no software installation necessary).

The presentation is available here: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.14068657

item.title: TU Delft Computational mechanics staff meeting
item.dc:creator: Tom van Woudenberg
item.description: During a TU Delft staff meeting of the department computational mechanics Tom van Woudenberg presented the use of TeachBooks in […]
item.content:encoded:
During a TU Delft staff meeting of the department computational mechanics Tom van Woudenberg presented the use of TeachBooks in a course.

The presentation focusses on how to use nested books in a course. The material is available here: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13927862

item.title: TeachBooks Lunch ClUB
item.dc:creator: Tom van Woudenberg
item.description: Thank you for those of you that came to our lunch pitch on Wednesday, we were encouraged by the interest […]
item.content:encoded:
Thank you for those of you that came to our lunch pitch on Wednesday, we were encouraged by the interest in our education projects, and look forward to seeing how you incorporate it in your own teaching practice! For those who could not make it, you can find the slides and a recording of the presentation using the links provided below. Please also consider filling out a survey about open education materials (online books in particular); this is part of a collaboration with colleagues from the Faculty of Applied Sciences, and your input will help us continue to develop software and obtain resources (e.g., more TA’s!) to help you use these tools in the future.

  • Slides and additional resources available at: doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.11378196
  • Recording of the presentation: youtu.be/MJT_EuWKjY0

item.title: Physics lecturer’s lunch
item.dc:creator: Tom van Woudenberg
item.description: During a ‘Docentenlunch’/’Lecturers lunch’ of April 24, 2024 at TU Delft University of Technology for the program of Applied Sciences, […]
item.content:encoded:
During a  ‘Docentenlunch’/’Lecturers lunch’ of April 24, 2024 at TU Delft University of Technology for the program of Applied Sciences, presented what TeachBooks has to offer. This presentation was done by Robert Lanzafame, Julie Kirsch and Tom van Woudenberg

The material is available here: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.11048593

item.title: Python in Teaching
item.dc:creator: Tom van Woudenberg
item.description: Following the successful Python4All Meet & Eat session on Python education at TU Delft, ‘Python in Teaching’ on 14 March (3.14) was organised by Freek […]
item.content:encoded:
Following the successful Python4All  Meet & Eat session on Python education at TU Delft, ‘Python in Teaching’ on 14 March (3.14) was organised by Freek Pols to strengthen the community that uses Python in teaching. This afternoon (12:30-17:00) at the TU Delft Teaching Lab includes sharing experiences, showcasing good practices, starting new collaborations, discussing ongoing topics and so much more. We, Robert Lanzafame and Tom van Woudenberg, presented how to use python in interactive textbooks

The presentation is available here: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10848459

item.title: Online Interactive Textbooks Symposium
item.dc:creator: Tom van Woudenberg
item.description: We, Robert Lanzafame and Tom van Woudenberg, gave a presentation at the Online Interactive Textbooks Symposium of March 4, 2024 […]
item.content:encoded:
We, Robert Lanzafame and Tom van Woudenberg, gave a presentation at the Online Interactive Textbooks Symposium of March 4, 2024 at the TU Delft Library. 

This was where we unveiled the program TeachBooks for the first time.

Content includes an overview of the MUDE book and how it led to TeachBooks, along with slides from our workshop, where we discussed the platform and unveiled a Template Book for making your own book with “our” interactive features in 15 clicks.

The presentation is available here: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10879004
